intro: Geranium ibericum subsp. ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian geranium, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of pink to violet flowers during the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
